content: By: Scott Wyden Kivowitz January 18, 2013 Stories Make $H!T Happen Content Marketing If you are in business, whether it is freelance or full-time, you most likely have a story to tell. When it comes to marketing, storytelling can be an extremely effective technique. One of the kings of storytelling for marketing purposes is Seth Godin. In fact, he wrote a book about it. In this article, I am going to share some of the ways you can use stories to generate more business. Read this post By: Carson Ward January 14, 2013 Why Content Goes Viral: the Theory and Proof Content Marketing Not all great content goes viral, but content that does go viral is great. Although we can't guarantee that any piece of content will take the web by storm, we can make sure that a piece of content has what it takes. Read this post By: Dan Tynski January 11, 2013 Infographics are Dead. Long Live Infographics. Content Marketing Below is a brief individual perspective on how I've seen popular content mediums evolve over the last five or six years, and why I feel this evolution is so important to track. I believe that through our study of this evolution, we can find some of the best opportunities available to us as marketers. Read this post By: Scott Wyden Kivowitz December 17, 2012 Building an Effective Content Marketing Campaign Content Marketing At Photocrati, we sell a WordPress gallery theme that has been purchased by around 15,000 happy customers (at the time I write this). The interesting thing is that we have never done a true content marketing campaign. Since we provide a lot of sales, marketing, business and SEO advice to customers, we eat our own dog food. The one piece of advice we never had used ourselves is a strategic content marketing campaign. So this is what we decided to do. Read this post By: Ryan Skinner December 14, 2012 Strategies for Content Marketing Differentiation: Stand out from the crowd Content Marketing Content marketing’s taken off in a big way; as more and more pile in, getting visibility will be harder and harder. Here are a few strategies to maintain and improve performance in the storm. Read this post By: Mackenzie Fogelson November 20, 2012 A Basic (yet essential) Pre & Post Content Launch Checklist (with guidelines) Content Marketing So, you think you're ready to launch some content? Before publishing your hard work for the world to see, check out these detailed pre and post content launch checklists to ensure your work has the best chance of survival possible. Read this post By: Stephanie Chang November 15, 2012 Having the Right Message During Difficult Times Content Marketing When tragedy strikes, businesses want to show their commitment to their customers and demonstrate support however they can. But sometimes, it's difficult to know the right way to approach the situation. Check out how these businesses, big and small, set examples of true customer support in recent times of crisis. Read this post By: Sarah Evans November 13, 2012 Open Social Collaboration: The Missing Piece of Your SEO and Content Marketing Strategy Content Marketing Managing SEO and content engagement strategies take a significant amount of time and effort to plan and execute. Get the most out of your hard work by integrating open social collaboration into the process to not only produce better work, but to improve your organic search results. Read this post K By: Kate Morris October 29, 2012 The Hope of a Link: Mashable Content Analysis Content Marketing Getting a link from a well-known site with high domain authority is the holy grail of SEO. In today's post, Kate Morris takes us into an Advanced Content Analysis to see just what kinds of posts Mashable loves to publish, which ones are most successful, and what days of the week are best for posting. Read this post By: Danny Ashton October 26, 2012 5 Awesome Infographics for "Boring" Niches Content Marketing In my last post for seomoz, someone asked me if infographics can still be successful for a “boring” niche. Niche topics can be pretty dull and inaccessible to most people. However, I believe that any niche can be made interesting by using ‘topic bridging’. By creating con... Read this post By: Kieran Flanagan October 24, 2012 The SEO Path to Becoming a Great Funnel Owner Content Marketing There has been plenty of recent discussion around the role of an SEO beginning to include a wide variety of inbound marketing tactics. Is it time for the responsibilities of an SEO to change, or is the term "SEO" as we know it evolving? Kieran Flanagan highlights why it's important for SEOs to become great funnel owners during these times of change. Read this post By: Larry Kim October 22, 2012 How I Got a Link from the Wall Street Journal Content Marketing Want to know how to get a link from the Wall Street Journal? In this content marketing case study today, I’ll describe in detail exactly how my team and I recently did just that! Read this post By: Gregory Ciotti October 22, 2012 3 Ways to Drastically Improve Outreach for "Big Content" [Case Study] Content Marketing During my time as a content guy for a few wonderful software startups, it's been made apparent to me that "big content" is definitely worth it. Despite the hassles and headaches that come with creating and promoting this sort of content, the return can... Read this post By: Steve Morgan October 17, 2012 Continually Updated Content and Extended Outreach - A Case Study Content Marketing Content can take many forms (or arguably any form!), but I'm sure we'd all agree that it still follows a sort of etiquette. For example, blogs typically get updated with newer, fresher content, sorted chronologically, with each post/article having its own dedicated URL; some posts will be evergreen and applicable for future readers, while some will be topical and applicable there-and-then (but may still be useful to refer to at a later date); and so on.
